授業目的: The purpose of this course is to provide students with an understanding of a research design and methods for conducting business research, particularly in the marketing area.
到達目標:
1.Students will acquire a practical understanding of research, its structure, and processes.
2.Students will be able to organize their research ideas and distinguish between good research and the one that falls short of professional quality.
3.Students will develop the ability to prepare a feasible and worthwhile proposal for the Individual Research course.

トピック.授業外学習2: This course is mainly for students who major in marketing. Before taking the course, students should have completed the Statistic or Business Analytics course.

評価.教科書Required texts0:
Mark Saunders, Philip Lewis & Andrian Thornhill, Research Methods for Business Students, 5th Edition, Prentice-Hall, July 2009.

A selected article will be discussed at the beginning of the course to familiarize students with research structure and contents. Students are then expected to choose and review two articles relevant to their research interest in class discussions.
